page.title: 01Our Area.
page.content: Our area is situated to the east of {Caradon Hill,}an area of granite rock and moorland over one thousand feet high. The area slopes quite steeply down into the ualley of the{River {Lynher.}The lower slopes are quite heavily wooded but the tree_cover decreases as you get higher. The land is mostly used for a mixture of dairy, beef and sheep farming so has smallish fields bordered by high hedges. Throughout the landscape are isolated farms and cottages built of local stone. The centre of population is the village of{Pensilva.}The old village is surrounded by modern housing estates, mostly bungalows. Nearly all the shops, services and meeting places are here such as churches, halls, school, health centre and public house. Philip Gordon Bond.
